overview_of_class:
This course will provide an overview of the logic and method
underlying empirical research in human biology and health. The course will introduce students
to the scientific method, as well as the process of research design, data analysis, and
interpretation. The course emphasizes hands-on laboratory experience with a range of methods
for assessing human nutritional status, physical activity, growth, cardiovascular health, endocrine
activity, and immune function.
name: Methods in Human Biology Research
title: WCAS ANTHRO 386-0-20 Methods in Human Biology Research

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
This course will provide an overview of the logic and method
underlying empirical research in human biology and health. The course will introduce students
to the scientific method, as well as the process of research design, data analysis, and
interpretation. The course emphasizes hands-on laboratory experience with a range of methods
for assessing human nutritional status, physical activity, growth, cardiovascular health, endocrine
activity, and immune function.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Priority given to anthropology majors pursuing the Concentration in Human Biology.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value:
Class participation, lab write-ups, research proposal. Due to the time-intensive
nature of laboratory activities, class attendance will be critical to success in this course and
make-ups will only be available under extraordinary circumstances.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Coursepack of selected journal articles & book chapters.

class_attributes:
Department Majors Only

Jrs, Srs, Grad Students Only
subject: ANTHRO
